```py
?sqrt
```

```py
require(stats) # for spline
require(graphics)
xx <- -9:9
plot(xx, sqrt(abs(xx)),  col = "red")
lines(spline(xx, sqrt(abs(xx)), n=101), col = "pink")
```

```py
# Multiplication before addition
3 * 5 + 6
#> [1] 21

# Division before subtraction
2 / 2 - 7
#> [1] -6
```

```py
1 * 2 # This comment is possible
#> [1] 2

# This comment is preferred
2 * 1
#> [1] 2
```

```py
# What is the absolute value of -100?
abs(-100)
#> [1] 100
```

```py
# These aren't going to work
ABS(-100)
#> Error in ABS(-100) : could not find function "ABS"
Abs(-100)
#> Error in Abs(-100) : could not find function "Abs"
```

```py
# Convert to upper case
toupper('I love R')
#> [1] "I LOVE R"
```

```py
# Is 3 greater than 4?
3 > 4
#> [1] FALSE
```

```py
# Assigning an object in R
my_first_object = abs(-100)
```

```py
# Printing an object in R
my_first_object
#> [1] 100
```

```py
my_second_object <- sqrt(abs(-5 ^ 2))
my_second_object
#> [1] 5
```

```py
my_char <- 'Hello, world'
my_other_char <- "We're able to code R!"
```

```py
my_num <- 3
my_other_num <- 3.21
```

```py
my_int <- 12L
```

```py
my_logical <- FALSE
my_other_logical <- F
```

```py
str(my_char)
#> chr "Hello, world"
str(my_num)
#> num 3
str(my_int)
#> int 12
str(my_logical)
#> logi FALSE
```

```py
# Is my_num equal to 5.5?
my_num == 5.5
#> [1] FALSE

# Number of characters in my_char
nchar(my_char)
#> [1] 12
```

```py
my_other_num <- 2.2
my_num <- my_num/my_other_num
my_num
#> [1] 1.363636
```

install.packages('tidyverse')

```py
# Call the tidyverse into our session
library(tidyverse)
#> -- Attaching packages -------------------------- tidyverse  1.3.0 --
#> v ggplot2 3.3.2     v purrr   0.3.4
#> v tibble  3.0.3     v dplyr   1.0.2
#> v tidyr   1.1.2     v stringr 1.4.0
#> v readr   1.3.1     v forcats 0.5.0
#> -- Conflicts ------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() --
#> x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> x dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
```

```py
update.packages()
```

```py
# Update R for Windows
install.packages('installr')
library(installr)
updateR()
```
